page.title: 06Wrangbrook Sewage Works.
page.content: On 3.7.85 we visited Wrangbrook Sewage Works.This is a small works,employing two men,Bob and Phil Senior.They are brothers.They like their job.The works cleans all the waste from Upton,about 500,000 litres a day.The job that Phil and Bob do is simple.They make dirty water clean again.To do this there are many stages.First the waste passes through the {Primary Stage,}where the solid material is screened.The {Solid {Waste Tank}is emptied twice a day,the waste being placed on drying beds where it hardens in 4 to 5 days.Once hardened it is moved from here.The water is pumped into {Humus Tanks.} Here the water is cleaned by{bacteria, which only live for 15 minutes.The bacteria eat the dirt in the water.Now about {250,000}litres of the water is pumped into the stream called {The {Skell.}
